content.raw:
Yes, that's how I had it in a custom version I was playing around with a couple of years ago.

We could now consider using the six PY2 flag rather than our own, but it's perhaps not entirely worth it at this point.

We should probably also add six as an official package requirement so it gets installed by pip automatically (not sure if this should be in setup.py/requirements.txt or both)
content.html:
Yes, that's how I had it in a custom version I was playing around with a couple of years ago.

We could now consider using the six PY2 flag rather than our own, but it's perhaps not entirely worth it at this point.

We should probably also add six as an official package requirement so it gets installed by pip automatically (not sure if this should be in setup.py/requirements.txt or both)
